Module overlap.py¶

modules.overlap.genome_solap_by_pairs(rows_to_filter, genome_fasta)¶

Partials overlaps will be filtered and joined.

Parameters

rows_to_filter (array 3D) – A Array 3D given by genome_solap_main() with all the supossed rows with overlaps.

Returns

Return type

modules.overlap.genome_solap_location_filter(chromosome_rows)¶

For the DNA (“minus” or “plus” strand) we get the start and end coordinates.

Parameters

chromosome_rows (python list) – Given by genome_solap_location_grouping(). It’s a Python list with all the rows from a CSV of one specific chromosome.

Returns

4 lists with the start and end coordinates for “minus” and “plus” DNA strands.

Return type

python list

modules.overlap.genome_solap_location_grouping(chromosome_rows, DNA_sense, max_diff)¶

This function will analyze each position of coordinates (start and end) for each DNA strand. It will group them depending on nearness.

Parameters

  • chromosome_rows (python list) – Given by genome_solap_minmax(). It’s a Python list with all the rows from a CSV of one specific chromosome.

  • DNA_sense (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

  • max_diff –

Returns

An Array 3D with the positions for “starts” and ends” in “groups” like [[[group1 starts][group2 starts][...]]   [[group1 ends][group2 ends][...]]]

Return type

Array 3D

modules.overlap.genome_solap_main(genome_fasta, naming_short, path_input, max_diff, writing_path_input)¶

Will call a variety of functions with the purpose of filtering overlaps in the data.

It uses chromosome_filter()

Parameters

  • genome_fasta (string) – Path to our whole genome sequence in FASTA format.

  • naming_short (string) – Label needed to read the ID of each cromosome in the .csv file. In the case of L. infantum for example, would be LinJ since the .csv file IDs are LinJ.XX.

  • path_input (string) – Path to the CSV file we want to filter data. It’s the output file created by blastn_blaster() and given here by modules.filters.global_filters_main().

  • max_diff (intenger) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

  • writing_path_input (string) – Path where the CSV file will be saved.

modules.overlap.genome_solap_minmax(chromosome_rows, max_diff)¶

After doing the groupings with genome_solap_location_grouping() for each DNA strand. We simply get the minimun or maximun value depending if it’s a groupings of “starts” or “ends”, but mainly on the strand (because “plus” and “minus” strands have like inverted coordinates).

Parameters

  • chromosome_rows (python list) – Given by genome_solap_main(). It’s a Python list with all the rows from a CSV of one specific chromosome.

  • max_diff (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

Returns

4 list with the minimum or maximun values depending if it’s a groupings of “starts” or “ends”, but mainly on the strand

Return type

4 python lists.
